H0.text: Carbon dioxide is the substance that a plant takes from the air in the presence of sunlight to make its own food.

H1.text: Hydrogen is the substance that a plant takes from the air in the presence of sunlight to make its own food, as Marshall learned that plants need a substance from the air to produce food.

H2.text: Nitrogen is the substance that plants take from the air in the presence of sunlight to make their own food.

H3.text: Oxygen is the substance that a plant takes from the air in the presence of sunlight to make its own food, as Marshall learned.

A4.text: Plants, algae and cyanobacteria use energy from sunlight to synthesize carbohydrates from carbon dioxide and water in a process called photosynthesis.

A5.text: Plants, algae and cyanobacteria use energy from sunlight to synthesize carbohydrates from carbon dioxide and water in a process called photosynthesis, which produces oxygen as a waste product.
